How can I retrieve the raw transaction data for a specific transaction ID using the Verus command-line interface?

You can retrieve the raw transaction data for a specific transaction ID using the `getrawtransaction` method in the Verus command-line interface. The basic syntax is `verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"`, where `"mytxid"` is the ID of the transaction you want to retrieve.

nds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)
 "blocktime" : ttt     (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)
}
```
Examples:
```bash
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid"
> verus getrawtransaction "mytxid" 1
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getrawtransaction", "params": ["mytxid", 1] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
